articles.title: A billion years from now, a lack of oxygen will wipe out life on Earth - Qrius
articles.description: The authors of this study estimate that the total habitable lifetime of Earth – before it loses its surface water – is around 7.2 billion years, but they also calculate that an oxygen-rich atmosphere may only be present for around 20%–30% of that time.
articles.content:
Matthew Warke, University of St Andrews
Earth will not be able to support and sustain life forever. Our oxygen-rich atmosphere may only last another billion years, according to a new study in Nature… [+5045 chars]
